page.title: 191953 Floods
page.content: The floods came on the evening of Saturday,31st January 1953.Some of the villagers took a lorry to Skegness Boating Lake and collected the boats, to help rescue the people trapped in bungalows at Ingoldmells Point. They could not row the boats for fear of being carried out to sea,so they had to walk with water up to their waists pushing them.Often they stepped into a dyke and then the water rose to their necks.Fortunately the landlord at the Ship Inn had stoked up his fires to dry the rescuers' clothes.Then he warmed them up with double measures of spirits (free).Many people were rescued - some even from the bungalow roof - but despite all their efforts 17 lost their lives.The tragedy was none need have died if they had put a chair on the table - and stayed there - not easy under the circumstances.
